sprint_goal: Establish the core solution architecture and implement the secure, encrypted database persistence layer.
epic_coverage: Core Architecture & Solution Setup,Database and Persistence
key_deliverables: Clean Architecture solution structure; Centralized DI and logging with PHI redaction; Secure PostgreSQL DbContext with TLS and pgcrypto encryption.
demo_objectives: Showcase the solution structure. Demonstrate PHI being redacted in log files. Prove data is encrypted at rest in the database.
success_criteria: All foundational components are in place and tested. Security review for logging and encryption is passed. Solution builds cleanly in CI.
risk_factors: Complexity of pgcrypto integration with EF Core. Incomplete PHI redaction logic.
mitigation_strategies: Develop a proof-of-concept for pgcrypto. Conduct rigorous peer review of redaction logic.
external_dependencies: TLS-enabled PostgreSQL server with pgcrypto extension.
burndown_target: Complete foundational tasks by day 7 to allow for integration testing.

sprint_goal: Implement the complete user login and role-based access control (RBAC) systems.
key_deliverables: Functional login screen; BCrypt password hashing; Authentication service; Centralized Authorization service; Role-based UI visibility.
demo_objectives: Log in as a Technician and show restricted UI. Log out. Log in as an Administrator and show full UI access.
success_criteria: E2E login flow is successful for all scenarios. RBAC correctly hides and disables UI elements based on user role. Security review of authentication process passed.
risk_factors: Incorrect implementation of password hashing. Inconsistent application of RBAC checks.
mitigation_strategies: Use a standard, well-vetted BCrypt library. Enforce a pattern for all authorization checks in ViewModels.
integration_windows: Final E2E testing of login and RBAC on day 8-9.
burndown_target: Backend auth services complete by day 5 to unblock UI integration.

sprint_goal: Implement critical security features: session inactivity lock/unlock and the complete audit trail system.
key_deliverables: Automatic session lock on inactivity; Session unlock screen; Centralized audit logging service; Audit Trail viewer for administrators.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate the application locking after a short (test) inactivity period. Successfully unlock the session. Show the audit log containing the 'Session Locked' and 'Session Unlocked' events.
success_criteria: Session lock/unlock is fully functional and preserves application state. All auditable events are logged correctly. Audit viewer allows filtering and exporting.
risk_factors: Performance impact of global input monitoring. P/Invoke complexity.
mitigation_strategies: Profile the input monitor for CPU usage. Isolate P/Invoke code in a dedicated, well-tested module.
integration_windows: Integration of audit service into unlock logic on day 7.
burndown_target: Backend services (audit, input monitor) complete by day 6.

sprint_name: Sprint 4: DICOM Ingestion & User Admin UI
sprint_goal: Deliver the core DICOM ingestion pipeline and User Administration UI foundation.
key_deliverables: Functional DICOM C-STORE SCP listener; Asynchronous study processing via RabbitMQ; Metadata persistence to database; User management UI with CRUD functionality.
demo_objectives: Send a DICOM study from a test tool and show the metadata appearing in the database. Demonstrate adding, editing, and deleting a user via the admin UI.
success_criteria: End-to-end DICOM ingestion is successful. User management CRUD operations are fully functional and audited. The system remains stable under concurrent C-STORE associations.
risk_factors: Data inconsistency between database and filesystem on ingest failure. DICOM interoperability issues.
mitigation_strategies: Implement idempotent message consumers. Use a data integrity check job. Test with dcmtk.
integration_windows: E2E testing of DICOM ingest pipeline on day 7-9.
burndown_target: DICOM SCP and RabbitMQ infrastructure complete by day 5.

sprint_goal: Deliver the high-performance DICOM viewer with core image manipulation tools.
key_deliverables: GPU-accelerated WPF control for DICOM rendering; HLSL shaders for window/level; Interactive tools for Zoom, Pan, and WW/WL.
demo_objectives: Open a DICOM study and demonstrate smooth, real-time manipulation of window/level, zoom, and pan using the mouse.
success_criteria: Viewer can load and display monochrome DICOM images. All manipulation tools are functional and performant. No GPU resource leaks are detected after prolonged use.
risk_factors: RISK-001: High technical complexity of DirectX programming. Key person dependency on graphics developer.
mitigation_strategies: Prioritize staffing a developer with graphics experience. Enforce pair programming and rigorous code reviews for all rendering code.
burndown_target: DirectX host control (TASK-041) complete and stable by day 7.

sprint_goal: Complete the user management lifecycle features and configure external DICOM communications.
key_deliverables: Password reset functionality for admins; Forced password change workflow for users; PACS configuration management UI with C-ECHO verification.
demo_objectives: Reset a user's password. Log in as that user and demonstrate the forced change workflow. Add and verify a connection to a test PACS.
success_criteria: E2E password reset and forced change workflow is successful. PACS configuration can be managed and verified.
risk_factors: Modifying the core authentication workflow can introduce bugs.
mitigation_strategies: Extensive integration testing for the login process with all user states (normal, temp password).
integration_windows: Testing of forced password change flow on day 8.
burndown_target: Backend services for password reset and PACS config complete by day 6.

sprint_goal: Deliver external DICOM query/retrieve functionality and the asynchronous printing system.
epic_coverage: DICOM Services & Processing,Printing, PDF, and Email
key_deliverables: DICOM C-FIND/C-MOVE SCU service; Interactive print preview UI; Asynchronous print job submission and processing.
demo_objectives: Query a test PACS for studies. Retrieve a selected study. Prepare a print layout and submit it, showing the job in the print queue and the application remaining responsive.
success_criteria: E2E query/retrieve workflow is successful against a test PACS. E2E printing workflow is successful, with jobs processed asynchronously. UI remains responsive throughout.
risk_factors: RISK-002: DICOM interoperability with external PACS. Complexity of WYSIWYG print preview UI.
mitigation_strategies: Test against multiple open-source PACS. Allocate sufficient time for UI development and testing.
integration_windows: E2E testing of C-MOVE and printing on day 8-9.
burndown_target: C-FIND/C-MOVE service and Print Preview UI structure complete by day 6.

sprint_goal: Deliver the application installer, first-run configuration wizard, and license validation.
key_deliverables: Signed MSIX installer package; First-run prerequisite validation wizard; License validation state machine (Licensed, Grace Period, Read-Only).
demo_objectives: Install the application from the MSIX package on a clean machine. Run the first-run wizard. Demonstrate the application entering read-only mode by simulating an invalid license response.
success_criteria: MSIX installer works correctly. First-run wizard correctly validates (and rejects) configurations. License validation logic correctly handles all states.
risk_factors: RISK-007: External dependency on Odoo API. MSIX packaging complexities with services.
mitigation_strategies: Robust unit testing of the license state machine with a mock API. Thorough manual testing of the installer.
external_dependencies: Code signing certificate; Mock Odoo API.
integration_windows: Final E2E testing of installation and licensing on day 8-9.
burndown_target: All features complete; focus on testing, bug fixing, and documentation.
